title: AI that predicts flash floods years in advance to protect UK's towns
text:
Artificial intelligence that can predict the risk of flash flooding years before it happens will be used by the Environment Agency to protect Britain's towns and cities.

A Cambridge University research student has created a system that estimates the risk of locations being affected by torrential rain, flash-floods and rising sea levels caused by climate change.

Robert Rouse, 30, created software that can gather and learn from thousands of historical and current data sources to detect whether an area is likely to be at risk of flooding in the future.

The system combines projections from climate models and past historical data at a local level - including rainfall, soil type, and weather patterns...
